title: Predicting Sampling Distribution Shape
question_text:
Suppose a random sample size $n = 9$ comes from a population that is approximately normal (bell-shaped).
One can conclude from this that the sampling distribution will be

choices.text: Unable to be determined since the sample is so small.
Not normal since the sample size is so small.

solution:
Since the data in the sample comes from a population that is approximately normal, the sampling distribution will also be approximately normal. Small samples (n<10) will have a sampling distribution shape that resembles the parent population.

It is important to note that no population will be perfectly normal (or bell-shaped), but many populations of quantitative data can be modeled by the normal distribution.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
